abstract: Growing number of economists say that collapse of housing prices, and consequent loss of equity for many Americans has caused permanent drop in confidence, which is the chief impediment to economic recovery.
snippet: The United States has a confidence problem, and a growing number of economists argue that the collapse of housing prices plays a major role.
lead_paragraph: The United States has a confidence problem, and a growing number of economists argue that the collapse of housing prices plays a major role.

headline.main: Gloom Grips Consumers, and It May Be Home Prices
headline.print_headline: Gloom Grips Consumers; It May Be Home Prices
headline.seo: Economic Outlook in U.S. Follows Home Prices Downhill
